definitions.definition: To (cause to) separate and go in different directions; to disperse.
To distribute loosely as by sprinkling.
definitions.example: Her ashes were scattered at the top of a waterfall.

definitions.definition: To occur or fall at widely spaced intervals.
A small quantity of something occurring at irregular intervals and dispersed at random points,
definitions.example: There will be a scattering of showers, with heavy rain in places.

definitions.definition: (elections) The total number of votes awarded to nonmajor or unlisted candidates.
The process whereby a beam of waves or particles is dispersed by collisions or similar interactions.
